conclusion: Determine the propagation time of monochromatic light in the water polo.
The light enters the water polo at point A and exits at point B.
The water polo has an inner radius R and an outer radius 8R/3.
The light travels along a straight line from A to B.
The distance AB is the diameter of the water polo, which is 2R.
Snell's Law relates the angles of incidence and refraction to the refractive indices of the two media.
Using Snell's Law: n1 sin(i) = n2 sin(r), with n1 = 1 (air) and n2 = 1.33 (water).
The refractive index n of water is approximately 1.33.
The speed of light in water v is given by v = c / 1.33.
Calculate the propagation time t = d / v = 2R / (c / 1.33) = 2R * 1.33 / c.
The propagation time of monochromatic light in the water polo is 2.66R / c.
